name: asexuality
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the fact of being able to produce young without sex or sexual organs: The asexuality of stick insects brings certain benefits, including rapid population growth. The island moss populations demonstrated a shift towards asexuality.
the state or fact of not experiencing sexual attraction (= the feeling of liking someone sexually): Public awareness of asexuality has been increasing. When I first read about asexuality, I realized this might apply to me.
the state of not being clearly male or female: They cultivated an air of asexuality. See
asexual
More examplesFewer examplesDespite asexuality, brine shrimp genotypes show considerable evolutionary divergence.Researchers are rethinking the asexuality of amoebas.My life changed when I saw a piece in the paper about the differences between asexuality and celibacy. Asexuality is not a conscious political or sexual statement: for us, it is the only thing that has ever made sense.Asexuality appears to be about as common as same-sex attraction.
